body_html:
@xiaocai00 : Could you please fill in the details asked for and provide a minimal, verifiable, complete example to reproduce the problem?

That said though, a recent change (0385bfe), which is not included in TensorFlow 1.8 but will be in TensorFlow 1.9, makes it possible to use Estimator objects even after eager execution is enabled.

So most likely the feature you desire should be in the next version of TensorFlow. (The release branch for which was just cut recently).

Hope that helps!
body_text:
@xiaocai00 : Could you please fill in the details asked for and provide a minimal, verifiable, complete example to reproduce the problem?
That said though, a recent change (0385bfe), which is not included in TensorFlow 1.8 but will be in TensorFlow 1.9, makes it possible to use Estimator objects even after eager execution is enabled.
So most likely the feature you desire should be in the next version of TensorFlow. (The release branch for which was just cut recently).
Hope that helps!
body:
@xiaocai00 : Could you please fill in the details asked for and provide a [minimal, verifiable, complete](https://stackoverflow.com/help/mcve) example to reproduce the problem?

That said though, a recent change (https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/commit/0385bfe0726ad9710bfcca145e19611e9e2391bb), which is not included in TensorFlow 1.8 but will be in TensorFlow 1.9, makes it possible to use `Estimator` objects even after eager execution is enabled.

So most likely the feature you desire should be in the next version of TensorFlow. (The release branch for which was just cut recently).

Hope that helps!
